data.title: Jennifer Hudson, Metta World Peace will play in the 2024 NBA All-Star Celebrity Game in Indy
data.meta_description: IndyCar driver Conor Daly and NFL players Micah Parsons and CJ Stroud are among the celebs competing in the game, set for Feb. 16 at Lucas Oil Stadium.
data.text:
The rosters for this year's NBA All-Star Celebrity Game, to be held Feb. 16 at Lucas Oil Stadium, were unveiled Wednesday morning.

Top names include singer, actress and talk show host Jennifer Hudson, former NBA star and Indiana Pacer Metta World Peace (formerly known as Ron Artest), NFL players Micah Parsons and CJ Stroud and IndyCar driver Conor Daly.

The celebrities have been split off into teams coached by ESPN personalities Shannon Sharpe and Stephen A. Smith.

Full coverage: Everything you need to know about 2024 NBA All-Star weekend

Shannon Sharpe's NBA All-Star Celebrity Game team

Micah Parsons

Conor Daly

Actor Quincy Isaiah

WNBA all-star Jewell Loyd

Streamer and YouTuber Kai Cenat

Actor Dylan Wang

Actress and YouTuber Lilly Singh

Singer-songwriter Sir

Country singer Walker Hayes (who is performing with Keith Urban as part of the event's Saturday festivities)

Latin singer Anuel AA

NFL wide receiver Puka Nacua

NBA All-Star Weekend: How to get tickets for Lil Wayne, Keith Urban, Zedd and T-Pain

Stephen A. Smith's NBA All-Star Celebrity Game team

Jennifer Hudson

Metta World Peace

Basketball entertainer Jack Ryan

Singer AJ McLean

CJ Stroud

Chef Kwame Onwuachi

WNBA player Natasha Cloud

Musician Adam Blackstone

Olympic high-jump champion Gianmarco Tamberi

NFL wide receiver Mecole Hardman Jr.

Who's coaching the NBA All-Star Celebrity Game?

Former Colts quarterback Peyton Manning and rapper 50 Cent will also serve as coaches on Sharpe's team, while WNBA MVP A'ja Wilson and Lil Wayne will assist Smith's.

More on Manning: Peyton Manning to coach NBA All-Star celebrity team for Indianapolis event

When is the NBA All-Star Celebrity Game?

The game will air live at 7 p.m. Feb. 16 on ESPN and the ESPN App. Former NBA player Richard Jefferson and former Indianapolis Colts punter Pat McAfee will be part of its broadcast team.
